content:
Topics covered during meeting

  1. Where can the documentation related to Template for the Project Management plan and Project Charter can be accessed?
    Project management plan and Project Charter materials are available on the NVSS COP SharePoint site under Meeting Proceeds > Main COP meetings > February 2022 folder (Back to the Basics with NVSS Modernization Efforts). https://cdcpartners.sharepoint.com/sites/NCHS/nvssmodcop/SitePages/Home.aspx

  2. Review of updates to the NVSS Modernization Tool Kit?
    • Section 3> Working towards FHIR based interoperability>
    o B. Connecting EDRS to NCHS> Added links to the NVSS API
    o D. SMART on FHIR> Added reference to Design and Evaluation Considerations for Mobile Applications and Other Tools to Support Death Certification
    • Section 5> Trainings and Recordings Section has been updated with several recordings to include How to get started with FHIR and Canary as well as an Overview of NVSS Modernization efforts. More recordings are in the final stages of production and are forthcoming; we will soon be adding An Overview of the NVSS API as well as other aspects of our modernization efforts as they become available.
    https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/nvss/modernization/tool-kit.htm

  3. Upcoming (03/16/2022) COP meeting Agenda?
    All about the Medicolegal Death Investigation Case Management System to EDRS workflow.

  4. Updates to the Implementation Guide?

  5. States that want to participate in providing input into the agenda of the COP meeting?
    Send an email to the nvssmodernization@cdc.gov mailbox.

  6. States that want to participate in an upcoming NCHS organized testing event?
    Send an email to the nvssmodernization@cdc.gov mailbox
    Great opportunity for States have never tested before

Regarding #4:
We are working to update the VRDR STU2 and FHIR Messaging Implementation guides, along with all associated software (canary, VRDR dotnet, etc) in time for the next testing event.

Both IGs are in final review after completing ballot reconciliation. We are dotting the i's and crossing the t's on the VRDR IG, so its current state should be very close to the version published as STU2. There has been significant addition of documentation. See for example the Decedent profile.
We expect a release of IGs and associated software around mid April 2022.

We invite your feedback on the latest builds of the two IGs.

Regarding # 4
The version of the IG and associated tools released in mid April 2022 will be used for the NCHS testing event organized in June, 2022. Note that the new proposed date for the NCHS testing event is June 27-28th (and not May 16-17th, 2022) This is to give jurisdictions and their vendors more time to update their systems and work with the tools leading upto to the testing event. NCHS will organize TA calls with jurisdictions that want to participate in the June testing event approximately 4 weeks prior. If you would like to participate, please send an email to nvssmodernization@cdc.gov
